title: Pembrokeshire Surf & Sea Week
tagline: Learn to surf on Wales' best waves
suitableFor: Beginner to intermediate surfers and outdoor enthusiasts comfortable with moderate physical activity. Ideal for those looking to learn new skills and explore the Pembrokeshire coast.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility, a strong aversion to cold water, or who prefer entirely sedentary vacations.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson at Whitesands Beach
stops.description: Start your surfing journey with a lesson at Whitesands, known for its consistent waves. Learn the basics from experienced instructors.

wetAlt.title: Visit St Davids Cathedral
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic St Davids Cathedral, a significant religious site with stunning architecture and a rich history.

budgetAlt.title: DIY Surf Session
budgetAlt.description: Rent a surfboard and practice on your own. Only recommended for experienced surfers who know Whitesands well.

stops.title: The Whitesands Beach Cafe
stops.description: Enjoy a casual lunch with stunning views of Whitesands Bay. Offers sandwiches, burgers, and hot drinks.

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch at Porthgain Harbour
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own packed lunch with views of the picturesque Porthgain Harbour.

stops.title: Ramsey Island Boat Trip
stops.description: Take a boat trip to Ramsey Island and spot seals, seabirds, and other wildlife. Learn about the island's history and ecology.

wetAlt.title: Oriel y Parc Gallery
wetAlt.description: Visit the Oriel y Parc Gallery and Information Centre in St Davids to learn about the area's art and landscape.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal Walk to St Justinian
budgetAlt.description: Walk along the coastal path from St Davids to St Justinian, enjoying scenic views of Ramsey Island and the coastline.

stops.title: St Davids YHA
stops.description: Budget-friendly hostel in the heart of St Davids. Offers private rooms and dorms, a communal kitchen, and a lounge.

budgetAlt.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping option near Porthclais Harbour with stunning views. Basic facilities available.

stops.title: Coasteering Classic with TYF Adventure
stops.description: Experience the thrill of coasteering along the St Davids coastline. Includes swimming, climbing, and jumping into the sea.

wetAlt.title: Explore St Davids Bishop's Palace
wetAlt.description: Discover the ruins of St Davids Bishop's Palace, a historic site with impressive architecture and a fascinating past.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Porthclais Harbour
budgetAlt.description: Walk around the picturesque Porthclais Harbour, enjoying the scenery and watching the boats.

stops.title: The Refuel Cafe Bar
stops.description: Enjoy a casual lunch in the center of St Davids, known for its burgers, sandwiches, and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch at Abereiddy Blue Lagoon
budgetAlt.description: Bring your own lunch and enjoy it with views of the stunning Blue Lagoon.

stops.title: Visit Abereiddy Blue Lagoon
stops.description: Witness the stunning beauty of the Blue Lagoon, created from an old slate quarry. Optional wild swimming for the brave.

wetAlt.title: Dive into a Book
wetAlt.description: Spend an afternoon in the YHA lounge reading books.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Abereiddy Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk along Abereiddy Beach.

stops.title: St Davids YHA
stops.description: Return to the St Davids YHA for another night.

budgetAlt.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping option near Porthclais Harbour with stunning views. Basic facilities available.

stops.title: Sea Kayak Safari from Stackpole Quay
stops.description: Explore the coastline around Stackpole Quay by sea kayak. Discover hidden coves and sea caves.

wetAlt.title: Explore the Bosherston Lily Ponds
wetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around the Bosherston Lily Ponds, a beautiful National Trust site.

budgetAlt.title: Walk to Barafundle Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk from Stackpole Quay to Barafundle Bay, one of Wales' most beautiful beaches.

stops.title: Stackpole Inn
stops.description: Enjoy a pub lunch at the Stackpole Inn, known for its local ales and seasonal dishes.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic at Barafundle Bay
budgetAlt.description: Pack a lunch and enjoy a picnic on the beach at Barafundle Bay.

stops.title: Paddle Boarding at Barafundle Bay
stops.description: Try paddle boarding on the calm waters of Barafundle Bay, a perfect spot for beginners.

wetAlt.title: Visit Pembroke Castle
wetAlt.description: Explore the impressive Pembroke Castle, one of the largest and best-preserved castles in Wales.

budgetAlt.title: Swim at Barafundle Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a swim in the clear waters of Barafundle Bay.

stops.title: Stackpole Centre (National Trust)
stops.description: Stay in a cottage or camp at the Stackpole Centre, a great base for exploring the area.

budgetAlt.title: Camping at Stackpole Centre
budgetAlt.description: Pitch your tent at the campsite.

stops.title: Surfing at Newgale Beach
stops.description: Spend the morning surfing at Newgale Beach, a long sandy beach popular with surfers and kitesurfers.

wetAlt.title: Visit Solva
wetAlt.description: Explore the picturesque village of Solva and its harbour.

budgetAlt.title: Walk along Newgale Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a long walk along Newgale Beach, taking in the sea breeze and stunning scenery.

stops.title: The Duke of Edinburgh Inn
stops.description: Enjoy a pub lunch with views of Newgale Beach.

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch on Newgale Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a packed lunch with amazing views.

stops.title: Coastal Walk to Druidston Haven
stops.description: Walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path to Druidston Haven, a secluded beach known for its natural beauty.

wetAlt.title: Indoor rock climbing
wetAlt.description: Head to an indoor rock climbing venue for an energetic afternoon

stops.title: Newgale Campsite
stops.description: Enjoy a night camping at Newgale Campsite.

stops.title: Coasteering in Tenby
stops.description: Tenby Adventure offers a beginner-friendly coasteering session, exploring the coastline around Tenby.

wetAlt.title: Tenby Museum and Art Gallery
wetAlt.description: Explore the history and art of Tenby at the Tenby Museum and Art Gallery.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Tenby's Beaches
budgetAlt.description: Walk along Tenby's beaches and enjoy the scenery.

stops.title: Hope & Anchor
stops.description: Enjoy lunch at Hope & Anchor, a popular pub in Tenby.

stops.title: Explore Tenby Town
stops.description: Wander around Tenby, taking in the shops and harbour views before heading home.

wetAlt.title: Shopping
wetAlt.description: Explore Tenby's range of independent shops.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Pembrokeshire weather is changeable. Pack for all conditions, even in summer. Sea temperatures are cold year-round.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in peak season, especially around St Davids and Tenby. Parking can be challenging, especially at popular beaches. Arrive early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for activities, especially during school holidays. Accommodation should also be booked well in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for surfing, coasteering, and kayaking. Coastal walks can be challenging in places.
